definition: Potiphar, the captain of the pharaoh's guard (in the account of Joseph in the Book of Genesis)
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
Bathsheba, wife of Uriah the Hittite and later of David (according to the Hebrew Bible)
Jezebel, wife of Ahab and mother of Ahaziah, major character in 1 Kings 16:31, 19:1, 21 and 2 Kings 9, killed by Jehu 耶戶|耶户[Ye1 hu4]
Ahab (9th c. BC), King of Israel, son of Omri and husband of Jezebel, prominent figure in 1 Kings 16-22
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
Pilate (Pontius Pilate in the Biblical passion story)
Herod the Great (73 BC - 4 BC), Roman-appointed king of Judea (37-4 BC)
